section.title: Terminology and notation

li.p: a pair of vectors whose dot product evaluates to 0

title.term: normal vector (to a line or a plane)

li.p: a vector that is orthogonal to the object of interest ( the line or plane being considered)

title.term: orthogonal projection (of a vector \uvec{u} onto a second vector \uvec{a})

section.p: When the initial point of \proj_{\uvec{a}}\uvec{u} is placed at the origin, the terminal point will be the point closest to \uvec{u} on the line passing through the origin and parallel to \uvec{a}.

title.term: vector component of a vector \uvec{u} orthogonal to a second vector \uvec{a}

section.p: When the initial point of the vector \uvec{u} - \proj_{\uvec{a}}\uvec{u} is placed at the terminal point of \proj_{\uvec{a}}\uvec{u}, it points towards the terminal point of \uvec{u}, at a right angle to the line that passes through the origin and is parallel to \uvec{a}.
